title: wishlist: Allow godoc to pregenerate HTML and use it instead of source code
body:
Hi,

this is more a wishlist than a defect.  And it will get more important in the long run
(when go stabilizes).

It would be beneficial if godoc could pregenerate pretty printed HTML pages for all the
pkg/, cmd/ and src/ trees.  This will make the packaging of golang more compliant with
FHS and more clean (IMO) since I won't have to include the whole source code into the
package.

The other part would to that godoc would be able to use the pregenerated files (stored
in the same directory structure) - or one would just point it's browser to
/usr/share/doc/golang-doc/html/index.html.

I have tried using the godoc -html=true, but the resulting HTML is really simple and
there's no easy way how to incorporate it into the whole documentation package.  (Also
there's no way how to generate f.e. /src/pkg/runtime/type.go by hand or at least I don't
know how...)
